newsitem.title: UK: Toyota to spend 60 mln stg in UK expansion.
newsitem.headline: Toyota to spend 60 mln stg in UK expansion.

text.p: Japanese automobile manufacturer Toyota Motor Corporation said on Wednesday it will invest 60 million pounds ($98.1 million) in expanding its European operations at its British plant.
The money will be spent on raising the capacity of its engine plant in Flintshire, North Wales, to 200,000 units a year.
Toyota is investing a total of 1.1 billion pounds ($1.8 billion) in its UK plant as part of its plans to boost its European operations.
A 200-million pound expansion programme was launched in 1995 to expand car capacity at its Derbyshire plant to 200,000 units.
The Derbyshire plant will make its five-door liftback Corolla model in addition to the Catrina E model which it already manufactures there.
The Corolla liftback will be launched in 1998 summer to be shortly followed by the Corolla hatchback, Toyota said.

"Europe is a central emphasis in our global strategy. We are aiming for a sales target of six hundred thousand automobiles in Europe by the turn of the century," a company statement quoted Toyota's president Hiroshi Okuda as saying.
The company said the increase in production capacity is likely to increase Toyota's total employment in the UK to around 3,000 from a current 2,450.
